Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: At this price I wasn't expecting much, just a cute little camera that conveniently used standard batteries for snapshots while travelling. It is cute and lightweight, but this camera is junk. Even at the highest settings the photos were grainy and blurry. I can't imagine who would be satisfied with the terrible photos. Don't waste your time or money on this one.

Reviews.Title: I've never hated a camera before...
Reviews.Author: Sally Mullaney "Catinmylap"
Reviews.Content: Polaroid should be embarrassed. These 500 series cameras are garbage. "Lightweight" means "made like crap".  "Easy to use" means it's only good for "point and shoot" at one setting.  I unload the images, erase the card and guess what? When I unload the next batch, they unload WITH THE SAME NUMBERS, so off they go to be with the first photo. Where?  Who knows? I tried creating a folder to load them into and renaming them. Nope. Help? Try to find a manual on Polaroid's website.  Redirect, redirect.  Menu in the camera is a joke. Macro/Landscape switch is on the side of the camera and gets flipped all the time.Yep, I may be a little more angry than a camera deserves, but I just uploaded photos from two important events - all blurry and grainy.  Yes, it was inexpensive but still overpriced for garbage. Like I said - Polaroid should be embarrassed.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Lyndsley
Reviews.Content: This is a very poor quality camera. It takes bad pictures and is not at all user friendly. I bought it for my 14 year old daughter, and she used it a few times, but now keeps asking to borrow my Kodak camera because she dislikes the pictures the Polaroid takes. I definitely would not recommend this camera to anyone. It's junk.

Reviews.Title: Worthless!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Content: I bought a silver one of these cameras as a stocking stuffer. I thought that at less than $40, it was a steal. Well it was a steal alright .......but by Polaroid! picture quality is poor, and the flash only appears to work with brand new batteries. After a couple of pictures, the flash stops working regardless of setting. In addition, the camera uses AAA batteries, which are not available as lithium. This means that it will need new batteries after only a few shots. What a rip off, my cell phone does better than this! Shame on you Polaroid, I will never buy anything with your name on it again!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Worst purchase I ever made...
Reviews.Author: Alice Henry "luv 2 read"
Reviews.Content: I do not like this camera. The photos are blurry, not even clear.My mom always told me "you get what you pay for" and now I believe it.

Reviews.Title: Much better out there for the price
Reviews.Author: Melissa M Pilch
Reviews.Content: My 8 yr. old daughter really wanted a camera, and I didn't think she needed a super quality one so I chose this for its price.  It is OK, but there is much better quality out there that is comparible in price.  5 MP almost doesn't even exist anymore.

Reviews.Title: I wish there was a negative star rating...
Reviews.Author: Shea "Sheacat"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for her birthday. To be fair I wasn't really looking for anything amazing considering that she is still young, but I am absolutely amazed at just how crappy this camera is. I can only assume Polaroid went out of their way to make this as a joke, because there is zero need for this product to exist in its current state. It doesn't even like to turn on correctly. Sadly, I seem to have lost the receipt so now I am stuck with it and left wishing I had just ponied up the extra cash to get a real digital. Or hell, even a disposable.

Reviews.Title: Kid's Toy
Reviews.Author: PeterTheHun
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 6-y/o daughter and she really enjoys using it. It's lower-than-entry level category, but what do you expect for the price?However, there are annoying details where the product details are misleading:- no digital zoom- no internal memory (when you turn on without SD card inserted, it won't let you shoot)- AAA batteries are depleted within 1 day of usage - this is the most annoying. I wonder if other users had the same experience. Tried different brands

Reviews.Title: i dnt like this.
Reviews.Author: laura
Reviews.Content: it feels like a cheap kid camera. it does take good pictures but the quality was nt what i expected. the seller delivered quickly and offers a return which i love but was disapointed in the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE
Reviews.Author: SC924
Reviews.Content: The camera appears to be a newer digital model in the picture but it in fact looks to be a kids toys. I am very dissatisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: mothers day gift for the deployed
Reviews.Author: rachelt
Reviews.Content: Probably the best gift I ever gave someone for personal gain! I am deployed and bought this camera for my Mother In Law- she had pictures of home uploaded to facebook the sameday! She loved it I loved it and it will last a lot longer than flowers or lunch!

8MB built-in storage
Takes video Clips
Polaroid Pixel Technology
AAA Batteries. Web Cam
